Sure, here is the section on Dispute Resolution:

Disputes related to design changes and other issues may arise during a construction project, and it is important for homeowners to have a plan in place to address them. Seeking legal advice and representation from a construction lawyer can help homeowners to navigate disputes and protect their interests throughout the project.

Alternative dispute resolution methods, such as mediation and arbitration, can be effective in resolving disputes related to design changes and other project issues. These methods involve the use of a neutral third-party to facilitate communication and negotiation between the parties involved. Mediation and arbitration can be quicker and less expensive than traditional litigation, and they offer the parties involved more control over the outcome of the dispute.

In summary, seeking legal advice and representation from a construction lawyer, and considering alternative dispute resolution methods, can help homeowners to effectively manage disputes related to design changes and other project issues. By having a plan in place to address potential disputes, homeowners can minimize their impact on the project timeline, budget, and scope.
